Nim library for scraping google search results.

Types

SearchResult = object
  url*: string
  title*: string
  snippet*: string
  Source Edit

Procs

proc hits(query: string): int {...}{.raises: [Exception, LibraryError, SslError, OSError,
                                    IOError, KeyError, ValueError,
                                    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError,
                                    Defect, OverflowError, ParseError, RegexError], tags: [
    ReadEnvEffect, RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
Search the given query string using Google and return the number of hits.

Examples:

doAssert hits("nim-lang") > 0
  Source Edit 
proc distance(term1, term2: string): float {...}{.raises: [Exception, LibraryError, SslError,
    OSError, IOError, KeyError, ValueError, HttpRequestError, TimeoutError,
    ProtocolError, Defect, OverflowError, ParseError, RegexError], tags: [
    ReadEnvEffect, RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}

Return the Normalized Google Distance (NGD) between two search terms. Result is roughly in between 0 and ∞. It can be slightly negative.

Notice: The NGD is not a metric.

More details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normalized_Google_distance

Examples:

doAssert distance("nim-lang", "pascal") > 0.0
  Source Edit

Iterators

iterator search(query: string; maxResults = 10): SearchResult {...}{.raises: [Exception,
    LibraryError, SslError, OSError, IOError, KeyError, ValueError, HttpRequestError,
    TimeoutError, ProtocolError, Defect, OverflowError, ParseError], tags: [
    ReadEnvEffect, RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
Iterator over each result that search the given query string using Google. Return maxResults items at most.

Examples:

for result in search("nim", 2):
  echo result.url & " " & result.title & " " & result.snippet
  Source Edit
